question_text: Why is port mirroring not always suitable for capturing all network traffic in forensic investigations?
answer_options: It uses encrypted VLAN tunnels by default
It strips timestamps from captured packets
It may fail to capture traffic under heavy load or misconfiguration
It converts all traffic to broadcast mode
correct_answer: It may fail to capture traffic under heavy load or misconfiguration
explanation: Port mirroring is dependent on switch software and can miss packets during high-volume scenarios or due to misconfiguration, making it less reliable for forensic-grade captures.
